snippet: Unless state legislation is quickly enacted, dozens of New York City religious groups will have to find new places for worship services.
abstract: Dozens of New York City religious groups are seeking new places for worship services because of a federal ruling that upheld a city policy of not allowing religious services in public schools; some churches are holding out hope that the Legislature will intervene as the State Senate is expected to consider a bill that would allow the churches to continue to worship in the buildings.
lead_paragraph: Unless state legislation is quickly enacted, dozens of New York City religious groups will have to find new places for worship services.

headline.seo: Some Churches Hope Albany Will Act to Allow Renting School Space to Pray
headline.main: For Congregations Gathering in City Schools, Time to Move
headline.print_headline: For Congregations Gathering in City Schools, Time to Move
